etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin (mentioned in the writings of Pliny), of unknown ultimate origin

definitions: a constrictor snake which bears live young and may reach great size, native to America, Africa, Asia, and some Pacific islands.

notes.text: Family Boidae, several genera and numerous species. See also boa constrictor

shortDefinitions: constrictor snake which bears live young and may reach great size

definitions: any snake that is a constrictor.
shortDefinitions: (in general use) any snake which is constrictor

definitions: a long, thin decorative scarf or stole made of feathers or a similar material

examples.text: a sequined ball gown and feather boa

shortDefinitions: long, thin decorative scarf made of feathers etc.
